meanings.definition: Criticize in an abusive or angrily insulting manner.
meanings.sent1: She reviles her classmates when they make mistakes.
meanings.sent2: He reviles his opponents during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The way she reviles her brother for forgetting his homework is quite harsh.
meanings.sent4: The politician reviles his critics to maintain his image.
meanings.sent5: The coach reviles the players to push them to perform better.

meanings.definition: Subject to verbal abuse or scornful language.
meanings.sent1: The reviles comments left her feeling hurt.
meanings.sent2: He felt embarrassed after receiving reviles remarks from his boss.
meanings.sent3: Despite the reviles remarks, she kept a smile on her face.
meanings.sent4: The reviles words stung like a swarm of bees.
meanings.sent5: The reviles behavior of the bully made everyone uncomfortable.
